alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 7:08PM MDT until further notice by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT/1245 AM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in northeast Colorado, Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT /1245 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 PM MDT /808 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Due to previous rainfall received over the past couple of days, flooding may sooner become an issue with heavy rain expected over the warning area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yuma, Wray, St. Francis, Benkelman, Bonny Reservoir, Bird City, Eckley, Haigler, Beecher Island, Laird, Vernon, Idalia, Hale, Parks, Heartstrong and Wheeler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
